notes: Kickboxing bout. Cikatic kicked White while on the ground.
Cikatic was penalized for illegal elbows, grabbing the ropes and striking Kerr in the back of the head.
Acknowledged by Coleman to have been a worked fight.
Initially ruled a win for Vovchanchyn,the result was changed to a "no contest" due to illegal knee strikes by Vovchanchyn.
Matsui defeated Schrijber via DQ (illegal kick) at 10:00 of round 1. Schrijber delivered an axe kick to the back of Matsui's head after the bell.
This marked the first time a member of the Gracie Family had been defeated in a mixed martial arts bout.
Tournament. Opening Round. Mezger forfeited the fight by leaving the ring after the bout was declared a draw and sent to an overtime round.
Tournament. Quarter-finals. The rules were modified to allow unlimited rounds. After 90 minutes of fighting, Gracie could not continue due to damage suffered to his legs.
Tournament. Semi-finals. Fujita's corner threw in the towel immediately due to injuries suffered in his quarterfinal bout against Mark Kerr.
Tournament. Openweight final. Coleman won the Pride Grand Prix 2000 tournament and the $200,000 grand prize.
Gracie elbow was dislocated during the submission attempt.
For The Pride Fighting Championship World Heavyweight Championship.
For The Pride Fighting Championship World Middleweight Championship. Sakuraba suffered a broken collarbone after being slammed by Silva.

notes: There was a lengthy pause a couple of minutes into the fight when Brennan released an armbar, believing that Mitsuoka had tapped out. Confusion ensued amongst both camps and the officials, and with replays inconclusive, the fight was eventually restarted.
